titleStmt.title: The poor mans prayer for peace, in these sorrowful times of trouble. Or, Poor England's misery in this time of distress. It is for our sins as we do understand, that all this great trouble doth lye on this land this innocent blood may make us all start, God bless us hereafter we take not a part our great God of heaven and our gracious King, let us serve and obey in every thing. To the tune of Game at cards.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden-Ball in Pye-Corner.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Poor Englands sorrows this many a year ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
